statement.tex: %text If \[ f(x) = x + 7 \] and $g(x) = x-7, x\in\mathbb{R},$ then find $(f\circ g)(7)$ %

step.reason:
%text $(f\circ g)(x)$ is simply shorthand for $ f\left( g\left( x\right)\right)$.
And similarly \[\qquad (f\circ g\circ h)(x) = \underbrace{f\left( \underbrace{g\left( h\left(x\right) \right)}_{(g\circ h)(x)}\right)}_{(f\circ g\circ h)(x)}\] %

step.context: %text Given that $(f\circ g)(x) = f\left( g\left( x\right) \right)$, what will $(f\circ g)(7)$ when $f(x) = x+7$ and $g(x) = x-7$? %
